title: Mummy wrapping
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Mummy_wrapping/zh-CN "Mummy wrapping/zh-CN")

| \[   mummy wrapping   [![Mummy wrapping.png](/images/9/9d/Mummy_wrapping.png)](/wiki/File:Mummy_wrapping.png) |                                                                                                                    |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Appearance                                                                                                    | mummy wrapping                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                    |
| Slot                                                                                                          | [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak")                                                                                       |
| AC                                                                                                            | [0](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class")                                                                               |
| Special                                                                                                       | - [MC1](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation")
- negates [invisibility](/wiki/Invisibility "Invisibility") |
|                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                    |
| Base price                                                                                                    | 2 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                                                                    |
| Weight                                                                                                        | [3](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                                                                         |
| Material                                                                                                      | [cloth](/wiki/Cloth "Cloth")                                                                                       |

A **mummy wrapping** is a type of [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [cloth](/wiki/Cloth "Cloth").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Origin](#Origin)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 NetHack brass](#NetHack_brass)
  - [6.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [6.4 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [7 Encyclopaedia entry](#Encyclopaedia_entry)

- [8 References](#References)

## Generation

Mummy wrappings are not generated randomly. [Mummies](/wiki/Mummies "Mummies") have a 6⁄7 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a mummy wrapping.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

While worn, the mummy wrapping provides no base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [MC1](/wiki/MC1 "MC1"), and also negates [invisibility](/wiki/Invisibility "Invisibility"): characters and monsters that are invisible wear a mummy wrapping will become visible as long as it is worn. Additionally, wearing a mummy wrapping prevents the effects of some items from turning the wearer invisible.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Large humanoids such as giants can wear mummy wrappings.

## Strategy

The mummy wrapping is the least effective cloak in terms of AC, but it is also the lightest of all cloaks and is more than sufficient to cover body armor, including protecting it from [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion"). It also does not have any base AC to lose to erosion - characters that lack a cloak may find a significantly-enchanted mummy wrapping to be a tempting option.

Characters that elect for permanent invisibility will often keep a mummy wrapping or two on hand for various purposes:

- [Shopkeepers](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") will not allow invisible characters to walk into their [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop"). A mummy wrapping can be quickly thrown on to get inside, and can optionally be removed after - leaving the store will require the character to put it back on, unless they exit through other means.
- Trapping an [aligned priest](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest") in their temple in order to convert the [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") requires that the priest be able to see the character.
- Wraiths cannot [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"), making it vital for characters planning to lure them off [graveyard](/wiki/Graveyard "Graveyard") levels to wear a mummy wrapping. The wrapping itself is poor protection against wraiths, and is best replaced with the character's usual cloak before fighting them.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Mummy wrappings give large humanoid pets an additional source of MC outside of the [cornuthaum](/wiki/Cornuthaum "Cornuthaum").

As of [commit 200cc21](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/200cc21fb3a31452c4448fa835ca595fcabfc488), priests gain the ability to break boulders that block their path, and can no longer be trapped.

## History

The mummy wrapping is introduced alongside mummies in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Mummy](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mummy "wikipedia:Mummy")***

The wrapping commonly associated with mummies in Ancient Egypt and other civilizations is used as part of the embalming and preservation process for burying the deceased. For Ancient Egyptians in particular, careful dehydration was performed to ensure that the body was completely dried out without being too stiff, then washed and wrapped in many layers of linen cloth. These linen bandages were covered with a gum that acts as a waterproofing agent and an antimicrobial agent - Egyptian priests placed small amulets within them to guard the deceased from evil in the afterlife. Once the mummy was completely wrapped, it was coated in resin in order to keep the threat of moist air away.

Though the popular image of the mummy frequently features them wearing wrappings, not all cultures that practiced mummification used wrappings, and mummies were often created through other means, including environmental ones (such as [bog bodies](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bog_body "wikipedia:Bog body")).

The encyclopedia entry is an excerpt from 1897 science fiction novel *[The Invisible Man](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Invisible_Man "wikipedia:The Invisible Man")* by *[H. G. Wells](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H._G._Wells "wikipedia:H. G. Wells")*, where the titular main character wraps bandages around himself to overcome his invisibility. This is also the basis for the mummy wrapping's ability to negate certain sources of invisibility, rendering an invisible wearer visible.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), mummy wrappings cannot be generated as or made into [invisible items](/wiki/Invisible_item "Invisible item").

### NetHack brass

In [NetHack brass](/wiki/NetHack_brass "NetHack brass"), cutting up a mummy wrapping with [scissors](/wiki/Scissors "Scissors") only produces a single [bandage](/wiki/Bandage "Bandage").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), many mummies that do not have a special form of wrapping associated with them will always generate with a mummy wrapping.

A mummy wrapping is the only cloak that can be worn to disguise the effects of having the [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") [Orthos](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\)#Orthos.2C_Sovereign_of_the_Howling_Dark "Spirits (dNetHack)") bound.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), player [tortles](/wiki/Tortle_\(starting_race\) "Tortle (starting race)") are capable of wearing mummy wrappings, giving them access to one more armor slot besides [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves"), [shields](/wiki/Shield "Shield"), and [helms](/wiki/Helm "Helm").

## Encyclopaedia entry

He held a white cloth -- it was a serviette he had brought  
with him -- over the lower part of his face, so that his  
mouth and jaws were completely hidden, and that was the  
reason for his muffled voice. But it was not that which  
startled Mrs. Hall. It was the fact that all his forehead  
above his blue glasses was covered by a white bandage, and  
that another covered his ears, leaving not a scrap of his  
face exposed excepting only his pink, peaked nose. It was  
bright, pink, and shiny just as it had been at first. He  
wore a dark-brown velvet jacket with a high, black, linen-  
lined collar turned up about his neck. The thick black  
hair, escaping as it could below and between the cross  
bandages, project in curious tails and horns, giving him  
the strangest appearance conceivable.

\[ The Invisible Man, by H.G. Wells ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 740](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L740)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Mummy wrapping

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
[   mummy wrapping  
Appearance mummy wrapping
Slot cloak
AC 0
Special
  • MC1
  • negates invisibility
Base price 2 zm
Weight 3
Material cloth

A mummy wrapping is a type of cloak that appears in NetHack. It is made of cloth.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Origin
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 SLASH'EM
    • 6.2 NetHack brass
    • 6.3 dNetHack
    • 6.4 Hack'EM
  • 7 Encyclopaedia entry
  • 8 References

Generation

Mummy wrappings are not generated randomly. Mummies have a 6⁄7 chance of being generated with a mummy wrapping.[1]

Description

While worn, the mummy wrapping provides no base AC and MC1, and also negates invisibility: characters and monsters that are invisible wear a mummy wrapping will become visible as long as it is worn. Additionally, wearing a mummy wrapping prevents the effects of some items from turning the wearer invisible.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Large humanoids such as giants can wear mummy wrappings.

Strategy

The mummy wrapping is the least effective cloak in terms of AC, but it is also the lightest of all cloaks and is more than sufficient to cover body armor, including protecting it from erosion. It also does not have any base AC to lose to erosion - characters that lack a cloak may find a significantly-enchanted mummy wrapping to be a tempting option.

Characters that elect for permanent invisibility will often keep a mummy wrapping or two on hand for various purposes:

  • Shopkeepers will not allow invisible characters to walk into their shops. A mummy wrapping can be quickly thrown on to get inside, and can optionally be removed after - leaving the store will require the character to put it back on, unless they exit through other means.
  • Trapping an aligned priest in their temple in order to convert the altar requires that the priest be able to see the character.
  • Wraiths cannot see invisible, making it vital for characters planning to lure them off graveyard levels to wear a mummy wrapping. The wrapping itself is poor protection against wraiths, and is best replaced with the character's usual cloak before fighting them.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Mummy wrappings give large humanoid pets an additional source of MC outside of the cornuthaum.

As of commit 200cc21, priests gain the ability to break boulders that block their path, and can no longer be trapped.

History

The mummy wrapping is introduced alongside mummies in NetHack 3.0.0.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Mummy

The wrapping commonly associated with mummies in Ancient Egypt and other civilizations is used as part of the embalming and preservation process for burying the deceased. For Ancient Egyptians in particular, careful dehydration was performed to ensure that the body was completely dried out without being too stiff, then washed and wrapped in many layers of linen cloth. These linen bandages were covered with a gum that acts as a waterproofing agent and an antimicrobial agent - Egyptian priests placed small amulets within them to guard the deceased from evil in the afterlife. Once the mummy was completely wrapped, it was coated in resin in order to keep the threat of moist air away.

Though the popular image of the mummy frequently features them wearing wrappings, not all cultures that practiced mummification used wrappings, and mummies were often created through other means, including environmental ones (such as bog bodies).

The encyclopedia entry is an excerpt from 1897 science fiction novel The Invisible Man by H. G. Wells, where the titular main character wraps bandages around himself to overcome his invisibility. This is also the basis for the mummy wrapping's ability to negate certain sources of invisibility, rendering an invisible wearer visible.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, mummy wrappings cannot be generated as or made into invisible items.

NetHack brass

In NetHack brass, cutting up a mummy wrapping with scissors only produces a single bandage.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, many mummies that do not have a special form of wrapping associated with them will always generate with a mummy wrapping.

A mummy wrapping is the only cloak that can be worn to disguise the effects of having the spirit Orthos bound.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, player tortles are capable of wearing mummy wrappings, giving them access to one more armor slot besides gloves, shields, and helms.

Encyclopaedia entry

He held a white cloth -- it was a serviette he had brought
with him -- over the lower part of his face, so that his
mouth and jaws were completely hidden, and that was the
reason for his muffled voice. But it was not that which
startled Mrs. Hall. It was the fact that all his forehead
above his blue glasses was covered by a white bandage, and
that another covered his ears, leaving not a scrap of his
face exposed excepting only his pink, peaked nose. It was
bright, pink, and shiny just as it had been at first. He
wore a dark-brown velvet jacket with a high, black, linen-
lined collar turned up about his neck. The thick black
hair, escaping as it could below and between the cross
bandages, project in curious tails and horns, giving him
the strangest appearance conceivable.

[ The Invisible Man, by H.G. Wells ]

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 740
